intro: Patagonium kingii, commonly known as the King's Patagonia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically broad and have a distinctive lobed shape. Patagonium kingii is adapted to harsh, cold environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
